titleStmt.author: Woods, Sarah B.

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Household Inventory List] 1843 Apr. 7, Westwood, [TN] [to] James Woods, Nashville, [TN] / Sarah B. Woods
bibl.author: Woods, Sarah B.
bibl.note: This is an inventory of household items made on April 1, 1843. It was made by Sarah B. Woods upon the death of Robert Woods, and sent to James Woods in Nashville who was the executor of the estate.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.opener: April 1st 1843. A list of Household and Kitchen furniture ⁁ & Books = on the plantation at Westwood
div1.p:
Wooden Ware.
1 Sideboard.
1 Sett dining tables.
5 Sofas.
1 pair card tables.
4 doz chairs.
4 Rocking chairs.
9 Bed Steads.
1 China press.
6 Small tables.
6 dressing tables.
2 Bureaus.
8 Wash Stands.
1 Wardrobe.
1 Candle Stand.
1 Old Piano Fort.
1 Large Irish Oak Ironbound chest.
} Beds, Towils &C {
8 Floor carpets.
6 Feather beds.
8 mattrasses.
15 Pair Sheets.
12 Pair Pillow Cases.
14 Counterpins.
12 pair of blankets.
5 dozen Towils .
9 Table Cloths.
8 Litts Bed Curtains.
} Waiters & China. {
4 Litts waiters, or tea bords .
1 Litt dining china.
1 Litt tea china.
Plated and Silver Ware.
1 soup turine .
1 Pair gravy turines .
1 Pair bottle Stands.
1 Pair dishes.
1 Pair Baskets.
1 Pair Waiters.
1 Caster Stand.
1 Coffee pot.
1 Tea pot.
1 Cream pot.
2 Sugar bowls.
1 Soup bowl.
2 ½ doz table Spoons.
1 ½ doz tea Spoons.
2 doz desert Spoons.
2 pair Sugar tongs.
1 Soup ladle.
1 Float laidle
2 Cream Spoons.
1 Larg Center candlestick.
3 Branch Candlesticks.
Glass.
1 Pair large glass Bowels .
3 dozen wine glasses.
1 ½ doz Chanpaign glasses.
1 doz jelly glasses.
1 doz tumblers.
4 Pair decanters.
Hardware & Cutlery.
6 pair handirons.
4 pair Shovils and tongs.
1 Stove (and furniture) for cooking
3 Pots.
3 ovins.
3 Soup kettles.
devers small tin pans.
20 milk pans.
3 wooden piggen
5 '' '' pailes .
2 China flower pots.
2 ½ dozen Knives & forks. ( Ivory hn )
1 Litt do Do (Metal hand )
Pictures &C .
2 pair looking-glasses.
4 framed-"Hunting plates."
4 Do Views of London; — Naples; — Athens; — & Bordeaux.
5 framed Poitraits .
13 smaller — engraved likenesses — and fancy Sketches. — Also — "A Sketch of New River Cliff —
and a Sketch of the Mountain near Gauly Ridge — Virginia". By Warrel.
2 maps of the United States.
1 Do of North America.
1 Do of Tennessee.bracket to the left of and indicating the last three items listed, says "Large Size" on next page
1 Small map of U States.
6 others of N & S America and Single States of the union.
Books.
A Library containing about 190 volumes. — togather with —
5 volumes = Scoll's Bible =
a large family Bible =
a Small Do Do =
3 Volumes of French
Revolution =
5 Volumes American Farmer
3 Coppies Johnsons & Walkers Dictionary.Several Books Medical Books purchased (by Pap) not long since — A parsel of School books — and "divers" Small Books laying about = also: a full sett of Waiverley novels belonging to dec, at Mrs. Branche's Received of James Woods Executor of Robert Woods decd. the above described articles of personal property devised to me in the will of the said decendent and I hereby exonerate said Executor from any further responsibility for them April 7 1843

add.place: upside down at bottom of page

closer.add:
Sarah B. Woods
To } Recpt. for Household & Kitchen Furniture & Books — 7th April 1843 ―
